text.p: Singapore Telecommunications Ltd (SingTel) shares saw heavy profit-taking on Tuesday, a day after the government allocated 809 million shares at a discounted price of Singapore $2.50 each to Singaporeans.
SingTel 100 shares were down 12 cents to S$3.18 around noon. It was the most active with 5.7 million traded.

"A lot of housewives are taking profit today as the volume is quite heavy in SingTel 100. Some funds are obviously buying as the price (of SingTel 100) is at a discount to SingTel," said an institutional dealer with a local firm.
SingTel 100 is traded in board lots of 100 shares.
SingTel, which is traded in board lots of 1,000 units, was trading a few cents higher at around S$3.22 a share.

The government said on Monday 1.53 million Singaporeans were allocated a total of 804 million SingTel shares in its second offer to Singaporeans. Another five million shares were taken up by self-help groups.
